bio1.questionPrompt: What was your background before web development?
bio1.questionAnswer: I'm a Nashville Native who worked in restaurants for the better part of a decade. After my wife and I had our first child, we realized the hospitality industry was not conducive to the family life we wanted.
bio1.seeMoreDetail: I left the hospitality industry in Fall of 2017 and began working on Eventbrite's Customer Experience team. Since April of 2019, I have been working with Eventbrite's External Developer Support team, assisting third party developers who are creating integrations using Eventbrite's API. Helping other developers navigate Eventbrite's API has been a great opportunity to both grow and apply what I've been learning at NSS in real-world use cases.

bio2.questionPrompt: Why do you want to go into web development?
bio2.questionAnswer: Web development has been an opportunity for me to use my love of puzzles and problem solving in creative real-life applications.
bio2.seeMoreDetail: Coding is just lego algebra, and I love legos and algebra. I would love to transition into a career where I can build tools and solve problems for a living. Getting to exercise creativity in problem solving is my absolute favorite thing to do, and the chance to do so as a profession would be a literal dream.

bio3.questionPrompt: What do you love about web development?
bio3.questionAnswer: I've loved discovering all the different methods and approaches there are to correctly solve the same problem, as well as the endless opportunities to learn new things.
bio3.seeMoreDetail: I want to be a web developer because it requires constant learning and growth, as well as providing the opportunity for a life that allows me to both provide and be present for my family.
